requeſts earth grown ſo near hell may made like heaven know love obey glorifie thee perfection unity full delight becauſe thou haſt made nature ſuch cannot love ſelves haſt bound u ſeek others welfare grace preſuppoſeth nature neceſſary firſt wellbeing therefore fourth petition thou wilt ſupport nature maintain neceſſary food ſuſtenance make u content thy allowance ſave u covetouſneſs overmuch love fleſhly deſires 20 certain beggar named lazarus laid gate full ſores 21 deſiring fed crumb fell rich man table moreover dog came licked ſores 20 21 note 1 like ſome relief elſe would layn 2 worſt men uſually moſt afflicted life 3 rich fleſhly men make great difference themſelves poor think ſuperfluities ſumptuous delicious fare muſt preferred neceſſities poor brother 4 dog help rich senſualiſt would help competent degree 22 came paſs beggar died carried angel abraham boſom rich man alſo died buried 22 note though parable chriſt would inſinuate falſe doctrine therefore ſheweth soul doth die body goeth joy miſery abraham alive lazarus boſom final reſurrection 2 death quickly levelleth rich poor voluptuous afflicted 3 angel guard juſt life refuſe death ſerve soul convoy unto happineſs 4 ſin example perfect holineſs thereby ſhewed enmity ſin began holy enterpriſe deſtruction 4 righteouſneſs law might fulfilled u walk fleſh ſpirit 4 true righteouſneſs law made lead men might found u true end law obtained u live spiritual principle rule carnal principle letter 5 fleſh mind thing fleſh ſpirit thing ſpirit 5 unregenerate dominion carnal diſpoſition though may terror threatning law xiii 1 let every ſoul ſubject unto higher power power god power ordained god 1 one duty neceſſary peace required god due subjection governours take heed therefore opinion think chriſt hath ſet u free humane government god god order natural effect uſeth natural mean ſo politick government uſeth officer ſpeak meer strength authority right govern ſubordinate magiſtrates ſuch power given supreme ſo impoſſible supreme ruler earth true authority given god univerſal sovereign even impoſſible creature without creator thing even muſt obey ſinful command yet muſt ſubject ſtill none exempted duty government ordinance god 2 whoſoever therefore reſiſteth power reſiſteth ordinance god reſiſt ſhall receive themſelves damnation 2 whoever therefore ſubject humane government reſiſteth true authority c 22 cauſe alſo much hindred coming 23 place theſe part great deſire theſe many year come unto 24 whenſoever take journey spain come truſt ſee journey brought way thitherward firſt ſomewhat filled company 22 23 24 ſuch work hindred coming rome vacant hope ſee go spain brought way firſt comfort company note paul knew god would ſend rome ſtop going spain 25 go unto jeruſalem miniſter unto saint
